ai.summary: A short, easy 0.9 km loop surrounding the Craven Lime Works area in the UK. Ideal for beginners, families, and a quick outdoor stroll, with potential views of lime kilns and local countryside.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly flat, well-maintained path with occasional grass sections. Expect compacted gravel, small roots or rocks, and damp or uneven ground near the lime works ruins, especially after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather conditions before you go. Wear sturdy footwear and stay on marked paths. Wet or icy surfaces can be slippery; be cautious near ruins or masonry. Bring water, dress in layers, and carry a small map or phone for emergencies.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate clothing (layers, waterproof if rain is expected)
Map or smartphone with offline access
ai.best_seasons: Spring–Autumn; winter visits are possible with warm clothing and proper footwear.
